info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 5:11PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern New Haven County through 600 PM EDT... At 511 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Middlebury, or near Naugatuck, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waterbury, Meriden, Wallingford, Naugatuck, Southbury, Wolcott, Cheshire, Prospect, Middlebury, Beacon Falls, Bethany and Oxford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern Connecticut.
